description: Borrowed from Malay keris. Doublet of kalis. Recognized as part of English ca. 1580.

entries.meaning: A traditional Indonesian or Malay dagger having a tapering, usually serpentine blade.
A Moro sword with an asymmetrical blade.

verbs.description: kris (third-person singular simple present krises, present participle krising or krissing, simple past and past participle krised or krissed)

examples: [...] when I was a boy, but Rajah Sul and Sultan Abdel krissed and speared all the poor people and burned the campongs.
